Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel on outskirts of town”
Reviews.Author: cpfc1984
Reviews.Content: A pleasent surprise when staying here as its situated onthe main road, I would suggest asking for a room at the back to avoid the early morning trafffic used the hotels dining in the evening and had a simple but decent meal. Range of beers is good though bar area is part of the restuarant so not a bar type atmosphere. Breakfast could have neen better but usual standard in France im afraid

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating staff, comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller14649
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times with my husband for business and on a recent trip brought our family along. We had two rooms and they were connected, which was very convenient. The rooms are small but comfortable, good size bath, and very clean. The staff is always friendly and helpful and on this occasion in particular they were very accomodating when we needed a late checkout. About 30-40 minutes by metro from the Eiffel Tower so keep this in mind if you are using the hotel as a base for Paris sightseeing. We had no problem getting a taxi from the airport to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Arc Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ideal for a weekend racing at Longchamp with good transport links to the course. A nice comfortable hotel. One big downside is transport from the airport some taxi drivers are loathe to go to west Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Les68
Reviews.Content: The Novotel is a typical chain hotel. The people at the front desk were incredibly accomodating, especially in helping me retrieve my luggage that was lost and coming the following day from a taxi. They had little toys for the children and were able to answer multiple questions. The room was small but had everything we would need, including a Nescafe coffee brewer. The hotel was clean and safe, and located right on the bus line, near the metro in Sevres. I stayed there because it was close to a friend's house, but I don't think I would stay there if I wanted to tour Paris. It's about a 15 minute walk to the metro, then a 30 minute ride to the center of paris. Breakfast bar was great and had a lot of choices. It was included in our rate. If it were not, I would have just gone to a bakery.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine - but look for specials”
Reviews.Author: DalleJensen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the outskirts of Paris, so you probably only choose this hotel if you have business in the area. The hotel is just fine, nothing outstanding, and you can often save a bunch by looking for the online specials when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the standard expected for a Novotel”
Reviews.Author: AwesomAndy
Reviews.Content: While it seems to be a nice place, there are too many issues and well below the expectation for a Novotel, and hence rated as such. The wash basin drain in my room was blocked, and likewise in the room of one of my companions. While, another room has a lock which, while still working, looks like someone has previously attempted to break into. I stayed for 2 nights, and had breakfasts there on both mornings. On both days, plates would run out every now and then, and weren't restocked for a good few mins. Likewise for the food (buffet). It is a pity though, as it actually looked like a nice place when I was in the lobby. And, given its location outside of the CBD, this is not a place I would return to unless improvements are made.

Reviews.Title: “JUST OK. OVERPRICED FOR LOCATION AND SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: ROULA-THANOS
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in April for a week at the hotel as part of our tour in Paris with a group. The hotel lobby is nice but not huge and there is corner on the restaurant side that can be used as part of the bar and you can have your drink. The location is far from the centre of Paris but it is a quiet residential area. We have been upgrade to JR Suite which was specious, with separated living room, 2 plasma TV set . The bed was confortable however the design of the room was Not rely what you should have expect from a 4* hotel and especially with the high rate per night you pay. Breakfast was ok with variety of dairy product, cereals etc. Same was sufficient to start your day. Staff was ok and they do speak good English. There is a metro station across the river bridge which is good 10min on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money for families”
Reviews.Author: Belalugosi Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a typical business-oriented three star hotel that seeks to attract families to fill the rooms over week-ends. Hence the week-end offer ("City Break") was extended to the Wednesday and Thursday nights with free breakfast. As usual with Novotel, children stay for free. Our room was slightly bigger than the usual "superior" (which really means "standard"), which was adequate for a family of four (the sofa bed could take 2 + 1 people). It faced the courtyard. That made the four-night stay good value for money. The choice for breakfast is reasonable and certainly wider than at the average independent three-star hotel. For instance salmon was out, but pancakes / actimel / smoothies were in. The staff at the bar and at the reception was overall very helpful - bar one particular irritating incident when the breakfast waiter forcedly sought to impose on us to sit at a table for six even though we were two families of seven in total. We were told that it was "up to him" to decide where we should be sitting. The Manager or Supervisor later apologised. The hotel is clearly situated off-centre and a ten-minute walk from the terminal tube station on the line number 9. This was fine by us - we looked for value for money - but may not suit "romantic strollers". From there, you'll reach the centre of Paris (St Germain/ Notre Dame) within 20' - 30', and the West (Trocadero / Eiffel Tower) within 15'. The area is adjacent to a wealthy district and feels very safe. We parked overnight in the street. Day-time on-street parking may be an issue, particularly if you play by the rule - e.g. feed regularly the parking meter. A parking fine for overstaying your time is €11 and my personal observation is that you have less than 10% of chance to get fined in any one day. Cars don't get clamped for metering offences. The hotel is 15' away by car from a large commercial centre ("Velizy" and "Velizy 2", the Brit equivalent to Bluewater although a bit more dated). Galeries Lafayettes, Printemps, Decathlon, etc,.. are there. You can also fill you boot before you journey back home with a large selection of wine at Auchan (closes at 10.00pm on weekdays). The hotel is also on the way to Versailles and its palace and to the wonderfull drive-in zoo of Thoiry. In conclusion, this hotel is good value for money for families, particularly if you come with a game plan and know your way around with the tube. I will recommend it to like-minded friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as expected”
Reviews.Author: AAM17
Reviews.Content: Looking at the pictures on line was miss leading. the rooms looked new and modern online, but when i got to my room it was not what the pictures looked like at all. my room was old and not what i was expecting. i am pretty sure there was newer lookin rooms in the hotel though. there was only 1 computer for all the guests. Dont get me wrong it wasnt horrible just average.

Reviews.Title: “this is not a way to treat your guests!”
Reviews.Author: liebe54
Reviews.Content: The hotel is o.k.' but we could not enjoy, because of the poor and not polite service of the stuff. Everyone knows that tha french are not so welcoming tourists, but we expect from a hotel stuff, to be more human, what they were not! we will never go back to this hotel! there are enough hotel in the area!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisH1976
Reviews.Content: I stayed there one night during a business trip to PSA. The rooms look quite new and the bathroom is quite big and looks fine. There is internet available but only for charge. The continental breakfast is really good for french standard, nothing was missing. The room price is not really a bargain but OK for this area.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELGIRL-CAD
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel because my tour booked it......it is only for 2 people to sleep but very strange, i got the room with 1 queen bed and 1 soft bed.....so i end up can stay with my parent instead of share room with my tourmate....... bath is good enough to use bed is ok even it is softbed area is not bad but far away from city of Paris..... total is good

Reviews.Title: “Average Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PennyLaneSussex
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the south west of Paris beyond the end of the metro line. It would not be suitable for the individual tourist stays in Paris but it is convenient for my business trips and I stay here when the Radisson in Boulogne Billacourt is full. It is the usual Novotel quality. Basic 3 star ,outdated decor, simple furnishings. The rooms have tea/coffee making facilities, and a clean bathroom. Windows can be fully open to get some fresh air, but you get the noise of the busy streeet in front of the hotel. My experience with the restaurant is that the service is pretty quick by French standards, but the menu is limited. It is fine if you are on business and just want a quiet night in the hotel but you would not travel to this place just to eat! Breakfast is normally very good but on my last visit I arrived in the breakfast area at the same time as an organised group of 30+ American pensioners. They took a long time to make their choices but were very charming about it.

Reviews.Title: “Less than average”
Reviews.Author: DTNPROMAN
Reviews.Content: The room was less than average. Dated and very worn. Outside the window of my 2nd floor room was the backdoor to the hotel restaurant and it was very noisy with an unattractive view because they actually store restaurant supplies outside. Speaking of the restaurant, the service in their restaurant was very slow and they didn't get the order right. The desk staff (one person) at check in was not friendly. There are better values in lodging in the area, so I for sure will stay elsewhere on my next trip to this area.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: parisvisitor3
Reviews.Content: We booked the Novotel Pont de Sevres based on the chain's reputation and the excellent rate of < 80 euro/night for an advance booking. However, there were no previous reviews about the hotel so we were a little apprehensive regarding our choice. We arrived in Paris via the Gare Du Nord and needed to ride the Metro for almost 40 min to get to the last stop, which was the Pont de Sevres station. As we got out of the Metro, we needed to walk another 5-10 minutes to reach the hotel. The property turned out to be a pleasant surprise, because it was bright and airy and the front desk staff were friendly and spoke English quite well. The room was large (1 bedroom suite w/ 2 large LCD tvs, a king sized bed and a sofa bed) and very clean. The hot breakfast buffet was also quite good, with a choice of breads, fruit, sausages, scrambled eggs, yoghurt, and even rice porridge for a few days. After exploring a little further, we found convenience stores and restaurants about another 10 minutes away and the locale was quiet and safe. Since it was located at the end of the line, the metro trains were never crowded and we were in the center of Paris in 20-30 minutes. I would certainly recommend the hotel to other travellers to Paris who are looking for good value.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel on the outskirts of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Traveler075
Reviews.Content: This is an acceptable hotel on the outskirts of Paris. Rooms are clean and functional, though bland. Breakfast buffet is quite good. There is an independently owned fitness center in the hotel which is decently equipped, but cramped. Front desk staff are good about being helpful--but if you are speaking to them in English you need to be cognizant of the fact that English is not their mother tongue.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as what you have paid!”
Reviews.Author: Micjas
Reviews.Content: For around 100 euro in this hotel, I don't think it worth the price. Though the room was clean, but the reception staff are very rude to the guest.

HotelInfo.Name: Novotel Paris Pont de Sevres
HotelInfo.Address: 11-13 Grande Rue, 92310 Paris, France
